OOC:

Actually proto humans can beat waspinator. Mind you he sucks and that's
probably why they can dismantle him :)


----- Original Message -----
From: <Legendarynemasis@...>
To: <nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Monday, June 03, 2002 2:56 PM
Subject: Re: OOC:


> Whee... okay Dewboy, you have been on this whole protohuman thing since
you
> first joined. Controlling proto-humans isnt going to happen. The council
will
> not put extremely important NPCs into the hands of players. In BW the
> Maximals interacted very little with the humans and thus that should be
> respected and shown in here. The protohumans would also get crushed in
combat
> with TFs they lack the know how to do so. While controling humans persay
> isn't a bad idea, it still isn't that good of one especially when you are
> talking about human ancestors. After all you have to look at this from a
> logical point of view, just how many transformers are going to be
attracted
> to primitive earth. We've had 5 or 6 factions already crashland onto the
> planet, that in itself defys some rational thought. Yes back stories are
good
> for them but sometimes its just enough. The RPG really doesn't need any
> wholey new factions to get it running again. It just needs a spark, an
> element of chaos if you will. So far everything that has appeared and
> happened has been pretty much voted on by the players, that just makes it
> boring. Once in a while something needs to happen that the players no
nothing
> about. Better RPing skills are built that way. As for the quintesson
> question, they were always around as far as the fandom know. They made the
> transformers and in the continuity as far as my knowledge goes the gobots
> were never recognized, although it is possible that they were or could
have
> been since in Five Faces of Darkness it begins with a galactic olympics,
> however they were also not able to identify one of the attackers that got
> caught so it also shows that at the time not everything was known. Anyway
> thats my 2 cents for now. Flame me if you want but this has been my
unbiased
> opinion.
>
>
